title: vmware
body: HI does anybody know whether vmware is bot or not? I mean can we using vmware to play lol? only open one game at the time, the host do not run it except vmware

replies.body: Running any kind of virtual machine, like using it to simulate an operating system that isn't actually installed, uses up a lot of resources and can hurt your performance in games. Not to mention Riot doesn't officially support [**third party programs**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/225266848-Third-Party-Applications), as we're unsure how safe or stable they are.

Thanks for reply. if I understand correctly, 

1. Riot just doesn't officially support third party programs not prohibited player to use it if their virtual machine  is capable to play the game, so it would not cause the account be banned, am I right? As you know, lots of computer can run VM and even run faster than some old actual pc. It would be no problem to play it at all.

2. The Virtual machine is a third party program not a bot, so using it is not botting, am I correct?

You should be correct. VMware wouldn't directly interfere with league. So it would be treated the same as running it on any old machine. I'm not sure if your IP address will change so be wary of that because it could be seen as account sharing. But my guess is that you would be in the clear.
